titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Francis Burton Harrison Papers 1786-1932
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Manuscripts and Rare Books Department Mss. 65 H26
titlepage.publisher: Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle:
Francis Burton Harrison Papers,
1786-1932.
did.abstract: Papers collected by Francis Burton Harrison. Chiefly typescripts of letters, 1786-1840, of members of the Harrison family. Also includes notes for The Harrisons of Skimino.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Francis Burton Harrison Papers, Mss. 65 H26, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Francis Burton Harrison was born in New York City 18 December 1873. He was the son of Burton Harrison and Constance (Cary) Harrison and the brother of Fairfax Harrison. He graduated from Yale University in 1895 and from the New York Law School. He served in the Spanish-American War and in Congress from 1907-1913. Harrison was governor-general of the Philippines 1913-1921. He lived in Scotland from 1921-1934. He served as advisor to the governors of the Philippines. Harrison died in Flemington, New Jersey, 21 November 1957. He was the author of Archibald Cary of Carysbrook, Aris Sonis Focisque (The Harrisons of Skimino), Burton Chronicles of Colonial Virginia, The Corner-stone of Philippine Independence,and a Selection of the Letters of Fairfax Harrison.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1786-1932, collected by Francis Burton Harrison. Chiefly typescripts of letters, 1786-1840, of members of the Harrison family, includes notes for The Harrisons of Skimino.

This group of typescripts, letters, and notes was collected by Francis Burton Harrison for the publication of The Harrisons of Skimino edited by his brother Fairfax Harrison. Box 1 contains typescripts of Harrison family letters and a few original manuscripts. Box 2 includes notes for The Harrisons of Skimino, correspondence between Fairfax and Francis Burton Harrison, material relating to the Gale family and to Pocahontas.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into series. Series 1 includes typescripts of Harrison family letters; Series 2 includes orginial manuscripts for The Harrisons of Skimino;Series 3 includes notes on source material for The Harrisons of Skimino;Series 4 includes miscellaneous notes and materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in chronological order by date.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.bibref:
Harrison, Fairfax. Aris Sonis Focisque, Being A Memoir Of An American Family, The Harrisons Of Skimino, And Particularly Of Jesse Burton Harrison And Burton Norvell Harrison.
1910.
Call Number: CS71 .H32 1910

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The papers of Fairfax Harrison, who is the brother of Francis Burton Harrison, are also located within Swem Library. These papers, 1736-1945, were produced and collected by Fairfax Harrison, and include his correspondence with individuals and institutions concerning his interest in Virginia History.

p.archref:
Fairfax Harrison Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.
Fairfax Harrison Papers, 1736- 1945. 6,116 items. Collection number: Mss. 65 H25

did.unittitle:
Letters,
n.d.
Letter addressed to "My Dear Son Samuel", unsigned, but note apparently by Francis Burton Harrison, states "Undated and unsigned - probably Margaret Harrison," n.d.
Note of money given William Harrison by his sons, William Jr. and Samuel Jordan, n.d.
Original Manuscripts, 1825-1839, n.d.
A. Stearns, Cambridge, Massachusetts to Jesse B. Harrison, Lynchburg, Virginia, 2 September 1825.
John Holt Rice, Theological Seminary, to Reverend Doctor Caldwell, Chapel Hill, North Carolina, 29 April 1826.
C. Anthony [n.p. - note indicates Lynchburg] to Jesse B. Harrison, n.p., 6 November 1831.
Tho. R. Ingalls, Jefferson College, to J. Burton Harrison, New Orleans, 21 September 1836.
Enclosed statement says "Memo by Jesse Burton Harrison," 16 November 1836.
Wm. P. Harrison,St. Louis, to J. Burton Harrison, New Orleans, 20 November 1639.
S. J. H. [Samuel J. Harrison] to J. Burton Harrison, New Orleans, 22 February [1839].
"E" [Elizabeth Harrison Metcalfe] to brother, J. Burton Harrison, New Orleans, 12 April 1839.
Memo by the widow of Jesse Burton Harrison [Frances Bland Harrison] for son, Burton N. Harrison, n.d.
Notes on Source Materials.

scopecontent.p: Notes on source material for The Harrisons of Skimino,and also includes correspondence with Fairfax Harrison.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Notes and Materials.
Notes on the Gale Family.
Papers pertaining to Pocahontas and portraits of Pocahontas.
